item.title: Venusaur Drop Event in Pokémon TCG Pocket—New Promo-A Cards, Rewards, Tasks & How it Works
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/venusaur-drop-event-in-pokemon-tcg-pocket-new-promo-a-cards-rewards-tasks-how-it-works/

Calling fellow trainers, the Venusaur Drop Event has landed in Pokémon TCG Pocket. We knew it was coming, and the content drop has graciously brought unreleased Promo-A cards, the chance to open more Packs, and a whole lot more—and this detailed guide covers everything you need to know.

The Lapras EX Drop Event in early November was a big success in Pokémon TCG Pocket. New battles were added, and we all had the chance to earn special Promo Cards—including a very viable Lapras card. As we head to the Christmas season, Pokémon TCG Pocket has dropped an early present with the Venusaur Drop Event, and we knew it was coming thanks to the future expansion leaks.

It has lots in common with the Lapras Drop Event but offers entirely new rewards and opportunities in Pokémon TCG Pocket.

What is the Venusaur Drop Event in Pokémon TCG Pocket?

The Venusaur Drop Event is a limited-time promotion in Pokémon TCG Pocket offering new Solo Battles, rewards, and Promo-A cards, that haven’t been available until now, starting on Nov. 29 and finishing on Dec. 12.

With the Venusaur Drop Event lasting two weeks, there’s plenty of time to get involved. FOMO shouldn’t apply here, but in any case, make sure you complete the battles and try to earn all possible rewards.

Keep an eye on your Event Stamina, because if you run out, you have to wait to try another battle!

Five new Promo A cards can be gotten in Pokémon TCG Pocket: Venusaur, Greninja, Haunter, Onix, and Jigglypuff.

The Mewtwo 10 Promo Card still isn’t ready; however, you can grab these new Promo A cards for your collection. Here’s a look at each card and its stats.

All Venusaur Drop Event Rewards in Pokémon TCG Pocket

Completing Venusaur Drop Event Solo Battles rewards you with Promo Packs, Shinedust, Shop Tickets, Event Hourglasses, Pack Hourglasses, and Wonder Hourglasses.

Each difficulty level in the Venusaur Drop Event grants “First-time Rewards,” “Chance Rewards,” and goodies for successfully beating Battle Tasks. Regardless of the difficulty, the Chance Rewards stay the same:

  • 1x Promo Pack A Series Vol. 2
  • 25 Shinedust
  • 1 Shop Ticket

Here’s every First-Time Reward listed for each difficulty level.

Every Venusaur Drop Event Task in Pokémon TCG Pocket & Rewards

Here’s a detailed look at every Task reward and the amount you can earn for each.

Are you happy with the Venusaur Drop Event? We think it’s cool, but let us know your thoughts. Plus, check out the rarest cards in Pokémon TCG Pocket, and how to play Pocket on PC.

item.title: STALKER 2 1.0.1 Patch Addresses Durability, Difficulty, and Dead Zones
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/stalker-2-101-patch-durability-difficulty-dead-zones/

STALKER 2’s massive 1.0.1 patch is here and it’s set to address 650 issues in the post-apocalyptic epic from GSC Game World. The update is live now on Xbox and PC and it effectively eradicates some of the biggest issues from the game, including controller dead zone problems, mutant difficulty, and weapon durability.

This is the second update of this size since STALKER 2 was released, and it stands as a testament to GSC’s desire to finesse the game as much as possible to appease the community.

STALKER 2’s 1.0.1 Patch is Insane

The full patch notes can be found on Steam, but I’ll sum up some of the most exciting changes coming with the STALKER 2 1.0.1 patch.

First, weapon and armour durability has been tweaked, which means that things won’t break as quickly and when they do, it won’t cost so much to fix things. That means you won’t be paying 20,000 Coupons to fix a single assault rifle anymore.

Also, GSC has addressed the monetary rewards you get from ‘most’ missions, giving you a few more Coupons in your pocket to play with.

Mutants have been tweaked – especially on lower difficulty levels – to make them much more bearable, including the Burer and Bloodsucker, which have been giving players headaches since day one.

This will please Xbox players: GSC has fixed the issue with gamepad dead zones. This has been a niggling problem since the game was released on November 20, and it can finally be put to bed.

Amongst the 650 bug fixes sits changes to almost every aspect of the game, from combat sequences to cutscenes, and from audio elements to quests. GSC has been hard at work to fix problems with AI interactions, UI problems, and blockers that prevent players from progressing through certain missions.

If you were concerned that STALKER 2 launched in a terrible condition, updates like the 1.0.1 patch should be starting to change your mind.

I still maintain this is my Game of the Year.
